decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of aggressive creatures and burn spells. By playing low-cost creatures and utilizing cards like Goblin Bushwhacker and Burning-Tree Emissary to quickly flood the board, the deck aims to deal heavy damage early on. The inclusion of burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast allows the deck to finish off opponents quickly or remove any potential blockers. Rally at the Hornburg and Reckless Impulse provide card advantage and help maintain pressure on the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively attack the opponent with low-cost creatures and burn spells while gaining life through lifelink and draining effects. The deck aims to quickly deplete the opponent's life total and disrupt their game plan with removal spells and land destruction. The mana base includes both Mountains and Swamps to support the red and black spells in the deck, with dual lands to help with color fixing. This deck prioritizes speed and disruption to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory.

The main idea of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage and tempo through efficient spells. By utilizing cheap removal, counterspells, and disruptive creatures like Spellstutter Sprite, the deck aims to maintain control of the board and dictate the pace of the game. Additionally, the deck includes card draw spells like Brainstorm and Deep Analysis to ensure a steady stream of resources. The inclusion of Gurmag Angler and Murmuring Mystic provides a win condition, allowing the deck to close out games once the opponent is sufficiently controlled.

The main focus of this UR Control deck is to maintain control of the game by utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and efficient creatures like Murmuring Mystic. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also generating tokens with Murmuring Mystic and dealing damage with cards like Lightning Bolt and Skred. The inclusion of card draw spells such as Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain helps to ensure consistency in drawing crucial cards. The mana base consists of Snow-Covered Islands and Mountains to support the use of Lórien Revealed and Skred.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Birchlore Ranger and Priest of Titania to flood the board with Elf creatures like Timberwatch Elf and Nyxborn Hydra. The deck also includes cards like Lead the Stampede and Distant Melody to draw more creatures and maintain board presence. With a mix of mana acceleration, creature synergy, and card draw, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a swarm of Elves and quickly close out the game.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Tolarian Terror, and Cryptic Serpent to apply pressure and win the game swiftly. It also includes a suite of powerful blue spells like Brainstorm, Counterspell, and Force Spike to control the game and protect your creatures. The deck aims to maintain a consistent tempo advantage through card selection and disruption, while also being able to close out games with efficient threats. Overall, this Mono Blue Aggro deck is designed to overwhelm opponents with a combination of speed and disruption.

The deck focuses on efficiently deploying cheap creatures with value-generating abilities to apply early pressure on the opponent. It includes disruptive spells like Cast Down and Eviscerator's Insight to clear the way for aggro creatures to deal damage. The deck also utilizes artifact lands and mana fixing to ensure consistent mana base. Additionally, it includes life gain sources to offset the aggressive strategy and provide some resilience against opposing aggro decks. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly with creatures like Quirion Ranger and Axebane Guardian, while using Walls like Overgrown Battlement to protect yourself. The combo involves using the Freed from the Real enchantment on a creature like Axebane Guardian for infinite mana, allowing you to play large threats like Valakut Invoker or Reaping the Graves to overwhelm your opponent. Lead the Stampede and Winding Way help you dig through your deck for combo pieces, while Saruli Caretaker provides additional mana ramp. The goal is to quickly assemble your combo and overwhelm your opponent with powerful creatures.

The main concept of this deck is focused on controlling the opponent's board while using gate lands to fix mana and generate card advantage. By playing disruptive spells like Counterspell and Journey to Nowhere, the deck aims to maintain control of the game until it can establish a strong board presence with creatures like Guardian of the Guildpact and Squadron Hawk. The deck also includes ways to protect its creatures and disrupt the opponent's strategies, making it a versatile and resilient control deck with a solid late-game plan.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize cheap artifacts and efficient creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggro and affinity strategies. By using cards like Myr Enforcer and Galvanic Blast to quickly build a board presence and remove threats, while also cycling through the deck with cards like Thoughtcast and Ichor Wellspring, the deck aims to maintain a high level of aggression while generating card advantage. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Krark-Clan Shaman and Nihil Spellbomb helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain control of the battlefield.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts to quickly overwhelm and aggro the opponent, with cards like Krark-Clan Shaman and Myr Enforcer providing strong creatures. The deck also incorporates various ways to draw cards and eliminate threats, such as Ichor Wellspring and Nihil Spellbomb. With efficient removal options like Galvanic Blast and Fanatical Offering, as well as access to extra mana through Drossforge Bridge and Mistvault Bridge, this deck aims to consistently maintain pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan while building towards a strong finish.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent by using low-cost creatures combined with burn spells. It aims to pressure the opponent early in the game and finish them off with direct damage spells. Guttersnipe, Kessig Flamebreather, and Sneaky Snacker provide consistent damage output, while Voldaren Epicure helps to drain the opponent's life total. Fiery Temper, Fireblast, Lightning Bolt, Lava Dart, and Grab the Prize are used as direct damage spells to control the board and finish off the opponent. Highway Robbery ensures card advantage and selection.

The main idea behind this deck is to utilize Persistent Petitioners as a win condition, by milling opponents' decks with a critical mass of these creatures. The deck also includes support cards to help find and protect the Petitioners, as well as generate additional creatures for board presence. The inclusion of cards like Gnaw to the Bone and Bellowing Crier helps to ensure survival and longevity during the game. The key strategy is to assemble the combo pieces efficiently and overwhelm the opponent with a flood of Persistent Petitioners.

The main focus of this red aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with cheap, efficient creatures and burn spells. By utilizing creatures like Clockwork Percussionist and Goblin Tomb Raider alongside burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. With a low mana curve and a high number of aggressive creatures, this deck is designed to maintain pressure on the opponent and finish the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main idea of this deck is to control the board by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to stall the opponent's game plan. By utilizing various spells like Lightning Bolt and Skred to deal with threats, as well as creatures like Murmuring Mystic and Tolarian Terror to generate blockers and win conditions, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and eventually overpower them with efficient control strategies. Ultimately, the goal is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up your own win conditions for victory.
